Dear Nino and Hagop,

 

We have been advised by the loss adjuster that they are not receiving any response from Chalhoub Team.

 

In view of this, they have recommended closure of this claim.

 

In case we did not receive any further response within 7 days, we will proceed with the closing of this claim.

 

Best Regards,

 

Vic Eldrin Munar

Dear sirs,

 

This is a long pending claim for almost one year. We haven’t heard rom you since our last message dated 06 December 2024. Please advise if we can close this file?

We intend to wait for response till 13/03/2025 and then plan to close the file with NIL claim recommendation. Look forward to hearing from you by then.

 

 

Regards,

OP

 

Capt Omprakash Marayil

Associate of Association of Average Adjusters

FICS, AFNI, MIIMS

chunks.text:
This is a long pending claim and please advise if we can close the claim. This claim is regarding 4 Pallets received in pressed condition from the shipment under AWB 172-82862334 on 15th April 2024.

Some of the boxes were in wet condition, however contents not affected.

From our inspection, the alleged damages noted were as follows: 

 

Product Code 

Description 

Quantity 

422.083

Tray with handless 53x42 Cm Alb

1

422.090

Tray with handless 53x42 Cm Alb

1

421.978

Tray with handless 53x42 Cm Alb

1

377.473 

Flatware set for 12 people 

1

 

During our inspection, the warehouse team informed us that they can replace the outer cartons of the affected items, but they require confirmation from the shipper before proceeding.

 

Please advise if we can close the file. If not, please submit your claim bill along with the supporting invoices. 

Look forward to hearing from you.

During our inspection, the warehouse team informed us that they can replace the outer cartons of the affected items, but they require confirmation from the shipper before proceeding.

 

Please advise if we can close the file. If not, please submit your claim bill along with the supporting invoices. 

Look forward to hearing from you. 

 

In closing and as a matter of routine protocol, please note that our enquiries into this matter continue on a without prejudice basis to the issue of policy liability. Nothing within this or future communication, or omitted from it, should be understood by you to confirm or imply any acceptance of policy liability on the part of the Insurer. Such enquiries are ongoing, and a decision with regards to policy liability (if any) shall be made by the Insurer once they are in receipt of all pertinent claim information and are in a position to do so. Insurers' assessment of policy liability (if any) is at all times subject to the Policy Terms and Conditions and all of Insurers' rights under the Policy are expressly reserved until otherwise communicated in writing by the Insurer or its authorized representative.

 

 

Regards,

OP

 

Capt Omprakash Marayil

chunks.text:
Above shipment is of 2 BUP PMC, flight arrive on 15/04 and same day AAS collected the PMC’s from DWC airport to our Cargo village warehouse. 

 

Delivery to DIP WH  - DATE & TIME 

We have receive the delivery schedule for 19/04 and delivery was done accordingly 

 

During the period from April 15th to April 19th, under whose custody were the four packages?  

Cargo was in AAS cargo village warehouse. 

 

Cargolux tracking indicated 2 pallets whilst the delivery order from M/S AAS Shipping mentioned 4 pallets.

CV tracking shows the MAWB package count, which was 2 PMCs and AAS DO shows HAWB package count which was 4 PLTS. 

 

SAGAR SREENIVAS​​​​

COORDINATOR ‑ SHIPPING

REAL FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

Without Prejudice to Policy Coverage

 

 

Dear Sir,

metadata.doc_id: C16D84M - survey attendance - etbt - allied enterprises - week 13- pot - 73375\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

Without Prejudice to Policy Coverage

 

 

Dear Sir,

 

Could you kindly provide clarification on the discrepancy between the tracking records from Cargolux and the delivery note from M/S. AAS Shipping L.L.C? 

 

According to the Cargolux tracking system, the shipment was delivered from DWC Airport on April 15, 2024, at 2213 hours. However, as per the consignee's delivery note, the cargo was received on April 19 at 1811 hours. Also, we have noted the Cargolux tracking indicated 2 pallets whilst the delivery order from M/S AAS Shipping mentioned 4 pallets. Please find the tracking and delivery order attached for your reference.

 

Also, kindly send us the copy of the Notice send to the forwarder and any further communications carried out with them.

 

During the period from April 15th to April 19th, under whose custody were the four packages?

 

Please clarify the above matter at the earliest.

chunks.text:
Also, kindly send us the copy of the Notice send to the forwarder and any further communications carried out with them.

 

During the period from April 15th to April 19th, under whose custody were the four packages?

 

Please clarify the above matter at the earliest.

 

In closing and as a matter of routine protocol, please note that our enquiries into this matter continue on a without prejudice basis to the issue of policy liability. Nothing within this or future communication, or omitted from it, should be understood by you to confirm or imply any acceptance of policy liability on the part of the Insurer. Such enquiries are ongoing, and a decision with regards to policy liability (if any) shall be made by the Insurer once they are in receipt of all pertinent claim information and are in a position to do so. Insurers' assessment of policy liability (if any) is at all times subject to the Policy Terms and Conditions and all of Insurers' rights under the Policy are expressly reserved until otherwise communicated in writing by the Insurer or its authorized representative.

 

 

Regards,

Bageo Ben Varghese

 

Marine/ Cargo Surveyor

Licensing Department Registration No. 309

 

1605 Fahidi Heights

PO Box 122127, Bur Dubai, 

United Arab Emirates
